structured_data.description: The Global Historical Climatology Network daily (GHCNd) is an integrated database of daily climate summaries from land surface stations across the globe, provided by NCEI. It contains records from more than 100,000 stations in 180 countries and territories, offering daily variables including maximum and minimum temperature, total daily precipitation, snowfall, and snow depth. Record lengths vary from less than a year to over 175 years. The dataset receives daily updates and is reconstructed each weekend.

While the study focuses on the contiguous US (CONUS), the datasets themselves are global in nature. It highlights that gridded datasets generally captured extreme heat better than extreme cold or heavy precipitation.
